User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/4.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E)

Steps to reproduce:

In high contrast mode, change the border-width of an "input" 


Actual results:

Visually there is no change


Expected results:

The border width should change
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/4.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E)

Steps to reproduce:

In high contrast mode, change the border-width of an "input" 


Actual results:

Visually there is no change


Expected results:

The border width should change
In high contrast mode we force the OS-default rendering, so I believe this may be working as designed.
